newsitem.title: GERMANY: German bourse to reorganise stock classification.
newsitem.headline: German bourse to reorganise stock classification.

text.p: German bourse operating company Deutsche Boerse AG said on Tuesday that it plans a reorganisation of Germany's 800 listed companies into new classifications.
A bourse spokesman confirmed a report in the German magazine Capital, which said that the bourse planned to divide shares up by liquidity and transparency.
However, the spokesman said that there was no question that the new divisions would mean the end of the current system of classification into official trade, regulated trade and OTC trade.
Such a change would require a change in legislation governing the bourse.

Companies will be split up into different transparency classifications, depending on how open they are about balance sheet information or whether they report using German or U.S. accounting standards.

It had yet to be decided how the new classifications would be established and the spokesman did not say when the new system of classification would come into play. Capital said the new system would kick off in October.
